issue.title: DESIGN - Create a vector avatar for the Gitcoin avatar builder.
issue.body: I have some fun news. The Gitcoin avatar builder is about to get the ability to have MANY different avatar types on it. # 1 # 2 # 3 Starting with the release of the Bufficorn Avatar builder at ETHdenver 2020, we are going to be allowing MANY different avatar types onto the platform soon. ## How it works [Checkout these two sample avatar svgs](https://bits.owocki.com/v1umkr1e). If you open them up in your favorite SVG editor this is what youll see as the DOM structure Basically there are different categories of accessories.. And different permutations of that accessory.. And they are encapsulated as items in the DOM of the svg. ## Bounty Your task is to create an avatar concept for the avatar builder. To participate 1. Design an avatar from the request list below. 2. Post a sketch . 3. We'll chat about it; and I may invite you to post a full vector image of the avatar. 4. We'll chat about it; and I may invite you to post a full layer avatar file. The prize for a getting a full avatar file on the site will be 5 ETH. I will fund up to 5 of these in Q1 2020. ## Asks Here are some avatar styles that would be cool to add to the site: - Robot - Barbarian (think like Barbarian from Diablo Video Game) - Mage (think like Mage from Diablo Video Game) - Burning Man Participant - Orc (from Warcraft) - a wookie - a jedi - superhero / supervillian - Protoss (from Starcraft) - alien - Brooklyn Hipster - Rainbows/Unicorn Developer - Economist - Willy Wonkas Playground - pixel art avatars ## How to submit work Submit a PR to this directory https://github.com/gitcoinco/creative/tree/master/Product/Avatar on the gitcoin creative repo

issue.title: Add warning for Brave users
issue.body:
In v1, Brave introduced their native crypto wallet, which is rather intrusive and overrides Metamask.

Some users told me they would've loved to contribute to our [Sablier](https://gitcoin.co/grants/253/sablier) grant, but they couldn't because nothing happened after tapping the submit button. I jumped on TeamViewer to help them and it turned out that the issue was Brave - after disabling it, it went fine.

It'd be nice to display a warning for Brave users. Related: https://github.com/brave/brave-browser/issues/6053

issue.title: Default to Permissioned Bounties
issue.body:
<!--

### User Story

As a funder I want to have approval required as the default to avoid people squating my bounties.

### Why Is this Needed

People are squating permissionless bounties and not completing them.

### Description

Swap the order of permission types on the funder form.

issue.title: as a end user I would like to be able to livestream via my status updates on gitcoin, so i can record messages for my community.
issue.body:
<!--
Hello Gitcoiner!

Please use the template below for feature requests for Gitcoin.
If it is general support you need, reach out to us at
gitcoin.co/slack

-->

### User Story

[comment]: # (As a <user type>, I want to <task> so that <goal>.)
as a end user I would like to be able to livestream via my status updates on gitcoin, so i can record messages for my community.

### Why Is this Needed

[comment]: # (Describe the problem and why this task is needed. Provide description of the current state, what you would like to happen, and what actually happen)
*Summary*:
face to face builds more empathy than text

### Description

[comment]: # (Feature or Bug? i.e Type: Bug)
*Type*:
feature

### Current Behavior
[comment]: # (Describe what actually happened.)
no ability to go live/ record a livestream on site.

### Expected Behavior
[comment]: # (Describe what you expected to happen.)
when a user goes to send a status update, they can also attach a livestream recording of themself.
1. when other useres scroll their feeds, itll show a video attachment preview in the 'post status update' module
2. the video is embedded and video can be played inline by viewers

### Definition of Done
[comment]: # (Any other information that would be useful, bullets are helpful.)
see above

### Additional Information
[comment]: # (Any other information that would be useful, content, screenshots, etc.)

pls only apply if u can PR within 48 hours.  and also pls select a technology provider (youtube maybe???) that can be integrated to enable this

See also: https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/pull/5840

comment.body:
@x5engine Hello from Gitcoin Core - are you still working on this issue? Please submit a WIP PR or comment back within the next 3 days or you will be removed from this ticket and it will be returned to an ‘Open’ status. Please let us know if you have questions!
* [x] reminder (3 days)
* [ ] escalation to mods (6 days)

Funders only: Snooze warnings for [1 day](https://gitcoin.co/issue/gitcoinco/web/5885/3936?snooze=1) | [3 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/gitcoinco/web/5885/3936?snooze=3) | [5 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/gitcoinco/web/5885/3936?snooze=5) | [10 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/gitcoinco/web/5885/3936?snooze=10) | [100 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/gitcoinco/web/5885/3936?snooze=100)

issue.body:
In v1, Brave introduced their native crypto wallet, which is rather intrusive and overrides Metamask.

Some users told me they would've loved to contribute to our [Sablier](https://gitcoin.co/grants/253/sablier) grant, but they couldn't because nothing happened after tapping the submit button. I jumped on TeamViewer to help them and it turned out that the issue was Brave - after disabling it, it went fine.

It'd be nice to display a warning for Brave users. Related: https://github.com/brave/brave-browser/issues/6053

issue.title: Favorites REST API (just Backend)
issue.body:
<!--
Hello Gitcoiner!

Please use the template below for feature requests for Gitcoin.
If it is general support you need, reach out to us at
gitcoin.co/slack

-->

### User Story

[comment]: # (As a <user type>, I want to <task> so that <goal>.)
As a user I want to be able to favorite bounties, kudos, users and grants to follow what interest me 
### Why Is this Needed

[comment]: # (Describe the problem and why this task is needed. Provide description of the current state, what you would like to happen, and what actually happen)
*Summary*:
Today is hard to track something that interest me if I didn't interacted with that in the past, even interacting, something need to change to receive a notification.
This will be integrated into the dashboard data (#4153) and will generate diff tickets for each UI integrations for each product areas (bounties, kudos, users/orgs and grants)

### Description

[comment]: # (Feature or Bug? i.e Type: Bug)
*Type*: Feature
Create different endpoints to interact with favorites table. This table will be a table of relations between the favorite and the sourced data ID

**[Endpoints docs](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/18800/S1a626JH?version=latest)**
`GET api/v0.1/favorites/:type`
`POST api/v0.1/favorites/:type/:id`
`api/v0.1/favorites/:type/:id`

**Documentation**
The documentation of the endpoints is in postman https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/18800/S1a626JH?version=latest

### Current Behavior
[comment]: # (Describe what actually happened.)
Doesn't exist

### Expected Behavior
[comment]: # (Describe what you expected to happen.)
Having an REST API ready to integrate

### Definition of Done
[comment]: # (Any other information that would be useful, bullets are helpful.)
API tested 

### Data Requirements
[comment]: # (How will we measure the success of this feature? What kind of tracking is needed for this feature (clicks, impressions, flag)?)
When implemented the UI this can make easy the life of users to follow what interest them most, finding bounties or people will be an easy task
Increment use of the platform
Decrement frustration
Make gitcoin more personal

### Additional Information
[comment]: # (Any other information that would be useful, content, screenshots, etc.)
https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/18800/S1a626JH?version=latest
This task is the very beginning and will be a final feature after design and front end work get done. 
With favorites new features will be possible, for example suggest favorite users when creating a bounty, follow up organizations new bounties, etc.

commits.message:
stable -> master (#5985)

* fix data model

* update active work

* fix feedback data

* fix icons

* uncomment 3box

* Add metadata card (#5889)

* Embed youtube videos from status

* Hide thumbanil by default

* Fix lint errors

* Substitute youtube URL regex

* Add metadata extractor

* Display embedded content for youtube and other content

* Change medium links to redirect to the gitcoin blog

* Update status.js

* Update activity.html

Co-authored-by: Kevin Owocki <kevin@gitcoin.co>

* 3box under alpha

* meta cards with links

* break line

* special format for new bounty

* makes it so that moderators can hide items on the feed with only one flag

* fix travis

issue.title: [3Box Integration] Add 'Upload to 3Box' button to Avatar Builder
issue.body:
<!-- 
Thank you for your pull request! Please review the requirements below, read through the contributor's guide, 
and ensure your pull request has fulfilled all requirements outlined by the Gitcoin Core team.
Have you read the contributors guide?: https://docs.gitcoin.co/mk_contributors/ 
-->

##### Description

<!-- Describe your changes here. -->

Based on the feature requested for https://github.com/3box/3box/issues/839, implement the GitCoin-3Box integration feature for Avatar Builder per the request of Kevin (@owocki). 

We will take advantage of what we have achieved in GitCoin and 3Box integration in https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/pull/5640, and extend the backup functionalities to Avatar Builder.

The design doc for this feature can be found here: https://hackmd.io/@L9ZnGph8Tbaio2GVX_z-EA/SylymWCAr


##### Refers/Fixes

<!-- If this PR is related to a Github issue, please add a link here. -->

https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/issues/5660

##### Testing

<!-- All PRs should be accompanied by tests! If you haven't added tests, please explain here. -->

Preview for this feature can be found below:

1. "upload to 3box" button

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46699230/71375357-ed34d080-25f8-11ea-9aa1-5f0b23665c4b.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46699230/71375342-dbebc400-25f8-11ea-801a-23ce4e8cebad.png)


2. Verify the uploaded custom avatar data in 3Box Hub

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46699230/71374966-a4c8e300-25f7-11ea-824b-c01f81e243d7.png)

(looks a bit messy due to the 3Box Hub UI)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46699230/71375005-bf02c100-25f7-11ea-8157-7f773ed8ed93.png)

comment.body:
@octavioamu sure. I think we're mainly blocked for testing with the profile data in production. 

as I mentioned in #5981 , it would be nice if we could run more testing in alpha, in order to collect the call stack (if met 500 error when export data), and query timeframe for large size profile.
